title: –ê–≤–∏–∞–∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω–∏—è Ryanair –≤—ã–Ω—É–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∞ –≤ —Å—Ä–æ—á–Ω–æ–º –ø–æ—Ä—è–¥–∫–µ –æ—Ç–º–µ–Ω–∏—Ç—å –ø–æ—á—Ç–∏ 100 —Ä–µ–π—Å–æ–≤
title_en: Ryanair is forced to urgently cancel almost 100 flights
summary_en:
Ryanair has cancelled almost 100 flights due to the strike in France.
The air traffic controllers' strike is taking place on the 84th day since the beginning of 2023.
Thousands of Britons are expecting a summer holiday as flights have been cancelled.
The cancelled flights are for people traveling to and from Beauvais Airport in Paris.
Ryanair criticizes the EU for failing to take action against the strikes.
The company is campaigning to protect aircraft flying through foreign countries during strikes.
Passengers are "fed up" with flight cancellations due to strikes and are demanding action from the EU Commission.
Strikes at the end of April led to the cancellation of 2,000 flights, and another 1,000 changed routes to avoid French airspace.

title: –ü–∏–ª–æ—Ç—ã Aer Lingus –≥–æ–ª–æ—Å—É—é—Ç –∑–∞ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É
title_en: Aer Lingus pilots vote for strike action
summary_en:
Aer Lingus pilots have begun voting for a strike over a wage dispute.
The voting will last until June 12.
The IALPA recommends that its members vote for industrial action, including a strike.
IALPA members rejected the recommendation of the Labor Court to increase the salary of pilots by 9.25%.
Captain Mark Tai believes that the salary offers do not reflect the large profits that Aer Lingus receives.
Management has been unable to reverse many measures, including salary reductions for new entrants.
Aer Lingus considers the IALPA vote unnecessary and negative for customers and other employees.
The inability of IALPA to participate responsibly in independent processes jeopardizes investment, growth and jobs at the airline.
Aer Lingus has announced the loss of the opportunity to purchase a new Airbus aircraft due to an ongoing dispute over pilots' salaries.

title: –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ–π –ø–æ–º–æ—â–∏ –í–∏–≥–æ —É–≥—Ä–æ–∂–∞—é—Ç –Ω–æ–≤–æ–π –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–æ–π
title_en: Vigo ambulance workers threaten new strike
summary_en:
Vigo ambulance workers are threatening a new strike due to non-fulfillment of obligations by the Ministry of Health.
The unions accused the administration of failing to fulfill obligations related to the operation of ambulances in the Atlantic.
Tragsa technical staff did not start work, and the ambulance link disappeared without prior notice.
The Ministry of Health acknowledged the stated facts and stated that the contract with Tragsa has not yet been finalized.
The unions pointed to the exhaustion of workers' patience and threatened to resume the conflict with maximum severity, including the announcement of a strike.
Requirements include starting the work of Tragsa technical staff, setting up a work system and communicating with the legal representation of employees.
The Ministry of Health and the Urxencias Sanitarias Public Foundation are working to accelerate all aspects related to the conclusion of contracts for urgent medical transport services in the Vigo area.

title: –í –ø—è—Ç–Ω–∏—Ü—É –Ω–∞—Å—Ç—É–ø–∞–µ—Ç –∫—Ä–∞–π–Ω–∏–π —Å—Ä–æ–∫ –¥–ª—è –≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ–π –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ TTC
title_en: Friday is the deadline for a possible TTC strike
summary_en:
Toronto transit workers are preparing to strike if negotiations on key issues do not change.
A strike could lead to a complete shutdown of transport services in a densely populated Canadian city.
Negotiations have reached an impasse, but are continuing with the Toronto Transportation Commission.
The main problems of the trade union are wages, benefits and issues related to job security.
A TTC spokesman says negotiations are likely to reach an impasse, but remains optimistic about the deal.
Both sides agreed to continue the work of Wheel-Trans, the city's paratransit service for people with disabilities, in the event of a strike.
